intro: Peucedanum melanotilingia, commonly known as the black-horned parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Peucedanum melanotilingia thrives in cool, moist environments and is typically found in rocky or forested areas.
